item.title: A few tuts for renamed cleints(reposted)
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

[anchor=info]Information[/anchor]
these small portions of tuts will teach you how to change textures edit the money colors and fixing the online and offline on your renamed client
i take very little credits on these, i followed tuts for unnamed clients and changed some things within the coding
i am shamon king on google so do not say i leeched this

Download for a renamed client
http://moparisthebest.com/downloads/srcAllDummysRemoved.tar.gz
all credits go to Moparisthebest
note: the link was found in the first reply to the topic it is called srcAllDummysRemoved.tar.gz

Table of Contents
[iurl=#textures]Adding Textures To Your Client[/iurl]
[iurl=#money]Changing The Money Colors[/iurl]
[iurl=#world]Fixing World 8/ World 1[/iurl]
[iurl=#sprites]Adding Sprites To Your Client[/iurl]
[iurl=#blf]Removing back ground fliping, logo and flames[/iurl]
[iurl=#cache]Changing The Location Of Your Cache[/iurl]

[anchor=textures]Textures[/anchor]
Classes modified: client.java
Difficulty: 2/10

the textures take place inside of method

private void method37(int j)

youll probably already have this little bit

[CODE] if(Texture.anIntArray1480[34] >= j)
{
Background background_2 = Texture.aBackgroundArray1474s[34];
int i1 = background_2.anInt1452 * background_2.anInt1453 - 1;
int l1 = background_2.anInt1452 * anInt945 * 2;
byte abyte2[] = background_2.aByteArray1450;
byte abyte5[] = aByteArray912;
for(int k2 = 0; k2 <= i1; k2++)
abyte5[k2] = abyte2[k2 - l1 & i1];

            background_2.aByteArray1450 = abyte5;
           aByteArray912 = abyte2;
            Texture.method370(34);
        }
    [/CODE]

thats the texture for the magic tree stars i belive
to add a diffrent texture you would add and change the 34’s to your texture id for example the fire cape would look like this

[CODE] if(Texture.anIntArray1480[40] >= j)//fire cape firecape
{
Background background_2 = Texture.aBackgroundArray1474s[40];
int i1 = background_2.anInt1452 * background_2.anInt1453 - 1;
int l1 = background_2.anInt1452 * anInt945 * 2;
byte abyte2[] = background_2.aByteArray1450;
byte abyte5[] = aByteArray912;
for(int k2 = 0; k2 <= i1; k2++)
abyte5[k2] = abyte2[k2 - l1 & i1];

            background_2.aByteArray1450 = abyte5;
           aByteArray912 = abyte2;
            Texture.method370(40);
        }[/CODE]

the 40s are the texture ids of the moving fire cape

[iurl=#info]back to top[/iurl]

[anchor=money]Changing the money colors[/anchor]
Classes modified: client.java
Difficulty: 1/10
first off search

int k10 = class9_1.invStackSizes[i3];

this little piece will see if the item is stackable or not if it is it will change the colors of amounts of the items

under neath that youll see this or close to this

int k10 = class9_1.invStackSizes[i3]; aTextDrawingArea_1270.method385(0, intToKOrMil(k10), j6 + 10 + j7, k5 + 1 + k6); aTextDrawingArea_1270.method385(0xffff00, intToKOrMil(k10), j6 + 9 + j7, k5 + k6); } } } } else

replace the old bits with this

int k10 = class9_1.invStackSizes[i3];//
aTextDrawingArea_1270.method385(0, intToKOrMil(k10), j6 + 10 + j7, k5 + 1 + k6);//
if(k10 > 99999 && k10 < 10000000 ){//
aTextDrawingArea_1270.method385(0xFFFFFF, intToKOrMil(k10), j6 + 9 + j7, k5 + k6);
}//
else if(k10 > 9999999){//
aTextDrawingArea_1270.method385(0x00ff80, intToKOrMil(k10), j6 + 9 + j7, k5 + k6);
}//
else{//
aTextDrawingArea_1270.method385(0xFFFF00, intToKOrMil(k10), j6 + 9 + j7, k5 + k6);
} 
}
}
}
} else[/code]
all this is doing is figureing out if the amount is above the number it will have this color
the

[code]k10 > #[/code]
if the amount is greater then that number it will show that color if not it goes to the next one and so one till it gets to the last one

these are the colors of the amounts of the items
i forget if their html colors or hex colors lol they both work out in the end tho
[code]0xFFFFFF
0x00ff80
0xFFFF00[/code]

[iurl=#info][b]back to top[/b][/iurl]


[s]                                                                                                                                                                                  [/s]


[anchor=world][b]Fixing the world 8/ world 1 to online offline[/b][/anchor]
[B]Classes Modified:[/B] client.java
[B]Difficulty:[/B] 1/10

first off search for
[CODE]if(j == 203)[/CODE]
not to sure what it does but it does something lol
above it youll see

[CODE]            if(friendsNodeIDs[j] == 0)
                class9.message = "@red@Offline";
            else
            if(friendsNodeIDs[j] == nodeID)
                class9.message = "@gre@World-" + (friendsNodeIDs[j] - 9);
            else
                class9.message = "@yel@World-" + (friendsNodeIDs[j] - 9);
            class9.atActionType = 1;
            return;
        }[/CODE]

replace all that with this
[CODE]           	    if(friendsNodeIDs[j] == 10)
                class9.message = "@gre@Online";
            else
            if(friendsNodeIDs[j] == 1)
                class9.message = "@red@Offline";
            else
                class9.message = "@red@Offline";
            class9.atActionType = 1;
            return;
        }[/CODE]
not much to explain on this but
[code]   if(friendsNodeIDs[j] == 10)
                class9.message = "@gre@Online";[/code]

that will tell the player that their online

[code]            if(friendsNodeIDs[j] == 1)
                class9.message = "@red@Offline";[/code]
this will tell the player that they have logged out or if they are not online

[code]                class9.message = "@red@Offline";
            class9.atActionType = 1;[/code]
the last part is if their ignored, or if they switch off their private chat

[iurl=#info][b]back to top[/b][/iurl]


[s]                                                                                                                                                                                  [/s]


[anchor=sprites][b]Adding Sprites[/b][/anchor]
[B]Classes Modified:[/B] sprite.java
[B]Difficulty:[/B] 1/10

in sprite.java search for
[code]public Sprite(StreamLoader streamLoader, String s, int i)[/code]
in their you see all these little intergers
scroll down till you see 
[code]myPixels = new int[j1];[/code]

your going to add all your sprite between
[code]myPixels = new int[j1];[/code]
and
[code]if(i1 == 0)[/code]

but first off so you dont get erros you would add
[code]else {[/code]
above
[code]if(i1 == 0)[/code]
thatll load the old sprites if you havent already added yours

example
[code]if (s.startsWith("prayer"))
	{
		try
		{
				Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./Sprites/"+s+" "+i+".png");
				myPixels = new int[myWidth * myHeight];
				PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, myWidth, myHeight, myPixels, 0, myWidth);
				pixelgrabber.grabPixels();
				//System.out.println("Sprite: "+s+" "+i+" loaded.");
			}
			catch (Exception exception)
			{
				System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
			}
		}[/code]

[code]if (s.startsWith("prayer"))[/code]
thatll be the name of your sprite
i prefer to use the startswith statment because it takes up less space

[code]Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./Sprites/"+s+" "+i+".png");[/code]
that is the location and name of your sprite

[code]				myPixels = new int[myWidth * myHeight];
				PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, myWidth, myHeight, myPixels, 0, myWidth);
				pixelgrabber.grabPixels();[/code]
that loads the image to find the height and width

your finished product of the code will look something like this if your haveing troubles
[code]        myPixels = new int[j1];
if (s.startsWith("prayer"))
	{
		try
		{
				Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./Sprites/"+s+" "+i+".png");
				myPixels = new int[myWidth * myHeight];
				PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, myWidth, myHeight, myPixels, 0, myWidth);
				pixelgrabber.grabPixels();
				//System.out.println("Sprite: "+s+" "+i+" loaded.");
			}
			catch (Exception exception)
			{
				System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
			}
		}

else {
        if(i1 == 0)[/code]

you can add more sprite into there by coping a sprite thats already added in their and changing it to your needs
or following the whole tut over and over again  :rolleyes:

[iurl=#info][b]back to top[/b][/iurl]


[s]                                                                                                                                                                                  [/s]

[anchor=blf][b]Removing back ground fliping, logo and flames[/b][/anchor]
[B]Classes Modified:[/B] client.java
[B]Difficulty:[/B] 1/10

it starts off with
[code]private void drawLogo()

in this method you will be able to get rid of the back ground fliping and the logo

scroll down to the end of the method till you see

sprite = null; Object obj = null; Object obj1 = null; System.gc();
right above that you see

sprite = new Sprite(titleStreamLoader, "logo", 0); aRSImageProducer_1107.initDrawingArea(); sprite.drawSprite(382 - sprite.myWidth / 2 - 128, 18);
this grabs the logo from the cache and places it on the back ground
the easiest way to get rid of it is to simply delete it

right above it is

aRSImageProducer_1110.initDrawingArea(); sprite.method346(382, 0); aRSImageProducer_1111.initDrawingArea(); sprite.method346(-255, 0); aRSImageProducer_1107.initDrawingArea(); sprite.method346(254, 0); aRSImageProducer_1108.initDrawingArea(); sprite.method346(180, -371); aRSImageProducer_1109.initDrawingArea(); sprite.method346(180, -171); aRSImageProducer_1112.initDrawingArea(); sprite.method346(382, -265); aRSImageProducer_1113.initDrawingArea(); sprite.method346(-180, -265); aRSImageProducer_1114.initDrawingArea(); sprite.method346(254, -171); aRSImageProducer_1115.initDrawingArea(); sprite.method346(-180, -171);
this will load the back ground from sprite.java and find the area it will be placed it
once again just delete that

now for the flames
to get rid of the flames start off by searching for

private void calcFlamesPosition()

all that method really does is add the flames and its colors

to get rid of the flames just delete that method so that this is left

private void calcFlamesPosition() { {

[iurl=#info]back to top[/iurl]

[anchor=cache]Changing The Location Of Your Cache (not url)[/anchor]
Classes Modified: signlink.java
Difficulty: 2/10

instead of loading your cache by useing the moparscape cache why not use your own
(moparscape cache directory)

C:/windows/.mpr_file_store_32/

to change the location it takes place in

private static String findcachedir()

in their youll see

return "somethinghere";

the

[b]somethinghere[/b]
will be the location to your cache for example [code]C:/Documents and Settings/username/Desktop/[/code] that would load your cache from your desktop on the c drive

you could also have

foldername/

that will locate the cache folder inside of your client folder

make sure that all \ are made into /

c:\src\cache\

will not work

c:/src/cache/

will work

[iurl=#info]back to top[/iurl]

Read full topic
